title: (x) Looking for contemporary alternatives to Rotis Semi Serif - various {gang}
content:
Hi,  
do you know a contemporary alternative to rotis semi serif (see pic)?  
A condensed sans with some retrofuturistic ¿labserifs?

+

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140412135810im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Bild3_5537.jpg)
author: Thorsten Geiger

comments.content: How about [Eidetic Modern](http://web.archive.org/web/20140412135810/http:/www.psyops.com/html/spec_eidetm.html)? It's serifed twin is [Eidetic Neo](http://web.archive.org/web/20140412135810/http:/www.psyops.com/html/spec_eideticneo.html).
Also, have you check Identifonts Similar fonts for [Rotis Semi Serif](http://web.archive.org/web/20140412135810/http:/www.identifont.com/find?similar=Rotis+Semi+Serif&q=Go)?
I actually find Rotis semi-serif quite contemporary in a timeless kind of way, but that's just me... It's one of my all time favourites!
It's certainly becoming ubiquitous here -- not to the point of being tiresome (yet) but definitely noticeable.

thanks, Eidetic Modern and Neo look fine (as I can judge them on [www.psyops.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20140412135810/http:/www.psyops.com/ "www.psyops.com")) but I have to wait for the condensed versions.
ah, thanks, didn't know this function. Works much better than the similar guesses from myfonts.

<cite>drrp, double post.</cite>

sorry, I've searched and browsed all rotis-topics.
[TheMix](http://web.archive.org/web/20140412135810/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/lucasfonts/themix_basic/) has semi-serifs, though I guess it's not quite the same feel.
